snippet: John G. Rowland, the former governor of Connecticut who served prison time after a previous corruption trial, made it clear he was not going quietly on this one.
abstract: Former Conn Gov John G Rowland, who served prison time after previous corruption trial, says he is not going down without a fight as closing arguments on his latest charges wrap up in federal court; Rowland is charged with seven counts of corruption, six concerning services he provided Lisa Wilson-Foley, Republican candidate for Congress in 2012.
lead_paragraph: John G. Rowland, the former governor of Connecticut who served prison time after a previous corruption trial, made it clear he was not going quietly on this one.

headline.main: Closing Arguments Ahead in Rowland’s Corruption Trial
headline.print_headline: Rowland Fights Back as Closing Arguments Near in Federal Corruption Trial
